segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 6
segments.en: Linked Discourses 6

segments.pli: 1. Paṭhamavagga
segments.en: 1. The Appeal

segments.pli: 6. Brahmalokasutta
segments.en: 6. The Negligent Brahmā

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā divāvihāragato hoti paṭisallīno.
segments.en: Now at that time the Buddha had gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.

segments.pli: Atha kho subrahmā ca paccekabrahmā suddhāvāso ca paccekabrahmā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā paccekaṃ dvārabāhaṃ upanissāya aṭṭhaṃsu. Atha kho subrahmā paccekabrahmā suddhāvāsaṃ paccekabrahmānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa went to the Buddha and stationed themselves one by each door-post. But Subrahmā said to Suddhāvāsa,

segments.pli: “akālo kho tāva, mārisa, bhagavantaṃ payirupāsituṃ;
segments.en: “Good sir, it’s the wrong time to pay homage to the Buddha.

segments.pli: divāvihāragato bhagavā paṭisallīno ca.
segments.en: He has gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.

segments.pli: Asuko ca brahmaloko iddho ceva phīto ca, brahmā ca tatra pamādavihāraṃ viharati.
segments.en: But such and such Brahmā realm is successful and prosperous, while the Brahmā living there is negligent.

segments.pli: Āyāma, mārisa, yena so brahmaloko tenupasaṅkamissāma; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ brahmānaṃ saṃvejeyyāmā”ti.
segments.en: Come, let’s go to that Brahmā realm and inspire awe in that Brahmā!”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, mārisā”ti kho suddhāvāso paccekabrahmā subrahmuno paccekabrahmuno paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes, good sir,” replied Suddhāvāsa.

segments.pli: Atha kho subrahmā ca paccekabrahmā suddhāvāso ca paccekabrahmā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso … pe … evameva—bhagavato purato antarahitā tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahesuṃ.
segments.en: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, they vanished from in front of the Buddha and appeared in that Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Addasā kho so brahmā te brahmāno dūratova āgacchante. Disvāna te brahmāno etadavoca:
segments.en: That Brahmā saw those Brahmās coming off in the distance and said to them,

segments.pli: “handa kuto nu tumhe, mārisā, āgacchathā”ti?
segments.en: “Well now, good sirs, where have you come from?”

segments.pli: “Āgatā kho mayaṃ, mārisa, amha tassa bhagavato santikā arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
segments.en: “Good sir, we’ve come from the presence of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: Gaccheyyāsi pana tvaṃ, mārisa, tassa bhagavato upaṭṭhānaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassā”ti?
segments.en: Shouldn’t you go to attend on that Blessed One?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutto, kho so brahmā taṃ vacanaṃ anadhivāsento sahassakkhattuṃ attānaṃ abhinimminitvā subrahmānaṃ paccekabrahmānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When they had spoken, that Brahmā refused to accept their advice. He multiplied himself a thousand times and said to Subrahmā,

segments.pli: “passasi me no tvaṃ, mārisa, evarūpaṃ iddhānubhāvan”ti?
segments.en: “Good sir, can’t you see that I have such psychic power?”

segments.pli: “Passāmi kho tyāhaṃ, mārisa, evarūpaṃ iddhānubhāvan”ti.
segments.en: “I see that, good sir.”

segments.pli: “So khvāhaṃ, mārisa, evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo kassa aññassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā upaṭṭhānaṃ gamissāmī”ti?
segments.en: “Since I have such psychic power and might, what other ascetic or brahmin should I go to and attend upon?”

segments.pli: Atha kho subrahmā paccekabrahmā dvisahassakkhattuṃ attānaṃ abhinimminitvā taṃ brahmānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Subrahmā multiplied himself two thousand times and said to that Brahmā,

segments.pli: “passasi me no tvaṃ, mārisa, evarūpaṃ iddhānubhāvan”ti?
segments.en: “Good sir, can’t you see that I have such psychic power?”

segments.pli: “Passāmi kho tyāhaṃ, mārisa, evarūpaṃ iddhānubhāvan”ti.
segments.en: “I see that, good sir.”

segments.pli: “Tayā ca kho, mārisa, mayā ca sveva bhagavā mahiddhikataro ceva mahānubhāvataro ca.
segments.en: “That Buddha has even more psychic power and might than you or me.

segments.pli: Gaccheyyāsi tvaṃ, mārisa, tassa bhagavato upaṭṭhānaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassā”ti?
segments.en: Shouldn’t you go to attend on that Blessed One?”

segments.pli: Atha kho so brahmā subrahmānaṃ paccekabrahmānaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then that Brahmā addressed Subrahmā in verse:

segments.pli: “Tayo supaṇṇā caturo ca haṃsā,
segments.en: “There are three hundreds of phoenixes, four of swans, and five of eagles.

segments.pli: Byagghīnisā pañcasatā ca jhāyino;
segments.en: This palace belongs to him who practiced absorption.

segments.pli: Tayidaṃ vimānaṃ jalate ca brahme,
segments.en: It shines, Brahmā,

segments.pli: Obhāsayaṃ uttarassaṃ disāyan”ti.
segments.en: lighting up the northern quarter!”

segments.pli: “Kiñcāpi te taṃ jalate vimānaṃ,
segments.en: “So what if your palace shines,

segments.pli: Obhāsayaṃ uttarassaṃ disāyaṃ;
segments.en: lighting up the northern quarter?

segments.pli: Rūpe raṇaṃ disvā sadā pavedhitaṃ,
segments.en: A clever person who has seen the deficiency in form,

segments.pli: Tasmā na rūpe ramatī sumedho”ti.
segments.en: its chronic trembling, takes no pleasure in it.”

segments.pli: Atha kho subrahmā ca paccekabrahmā suddhāvāso ca paccekabrahmā taṃ brahmānaṃ saṃvejetvā tatthevantaradhāyiṃsu.
segments.en: Then after inspiring awe in that Brahmā, the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa vanished right there.

segments.pli: Agamāsi ca kho so brahmā aparena samayena bhagavato upaṭṭhānaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassāti.
segments.en: And after some time that Brahmā went to attend on the Buddha.

suttaplex.blurb: The brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa note that a fellow-brahmā is living in negligence, overly impressed with his own glory, so they go to shake him from his complacence.
